function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Occupant vulnerability in the built environment leading to potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of timeline-based representation in the design process leading to inefficient analysis of design options.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in browsing large contact tracing datasets leading to inefficient data analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of quantification of simulated output leading to inability to score design options based on contamination or infection rate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in parameter certainty levels may lead to distrust in the system and customization with lower confidence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Critical shortcomings in the 3d visualization technique may limit users’ ability to have an overview of the entire space.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying solely on 3d representation for understanding complex behaviors and virus situations may lead to limited insights and understanding of the overall environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission through surface-touching and face-touching behaviors","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Concerns about the level of randomness in human behaviors in the simulation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Necessity of an explainable interface for occsim agency","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider individualized building layouts and ventilation frequencies for disease control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overwhelming users with too many configurable options","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 due to lack of understanding of design factors and their impacts.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for virus transmission in built environments from human interaction","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virtual interviews using zoom due to pandemic lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing physical tools mouse and keyboard during system testing","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Default simulation time step may not be optimal for modeling contagious diseases with different transmission rates and behaviors.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate validation of simulation accuracy may result in unreliable outcomes and recommendations for safe space design and policy-making.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data security and privacy risks associated with the large amount of simulation data stored in a sqlite database.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accumulated surface contamination from interactable objects","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interface for customizing contexts","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Manual assignment of tags to 3d objects","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex environmental aspects may impact virus transmission dynamics within the building.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Real-time visualization of air contamination may lead to heightened awareness but could cause undue anxiety among building occupants.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interactive 3d visualization of virus transmission may lead to privacy concerns and infringement of individual rights.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Customization of occupant properties may lead to inaccurate simulation of virus spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Default values for virus properties may not reflect the characteristics of a specific virus, leading to inaccurate simulation results.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The visualization methods may oversimplify the complexity of virus transmission in the built environment, leading to misinterpretation of simulation results.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated surfaces leading to virus transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate simulation configuration leading to inaccurate results","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective occupant behavior customization leading to increased virus transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of virus particles in the built environment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagion-related behaviours like breathing, sneezing, and coughing can lead to the spread of air-based contagions in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-based contagions from behaviors like surface-touching and hand-sanitizing may lead to the spread of contagious diseases through contact with contaminated surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Simulating virus-human-building interactions can lead to a better understanding of how contagious diseases spread in built environments, but may also present privacy and ethical concerns related to data collection and monitoring.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions facilitate virus transmission and contagion-related behaviors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virtual humans with agency behaving realistically within the building model can simulate virus transmission scenarios.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modeling contagion-related human behaviors within the building can provide insights into virus spread dynamics.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for micro-level behaviors such as breathing and touching in covid-19 transmission scenarios","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited flexibility for customizing configurations within the simulation tool","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Focus on small spaces with simple geometry in existing virus transmission simulations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete integration of agency into virtual humans to incorporate dynamics of human behaviour within the building.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglecting to incorporate contextual information in the building model for human behaviour simulation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying solely on macro-level mobility aspects in the simulation without considering micro-level interactions within environments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlooking connectivity between spaces due to building design can contribute to air-based and surface-based transfer of pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for individual and social behaviors in epidemic models and design decisions may lead to ineffective control measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the influence of behavior on the spread of covid-19 may hinder control efforts and re-opening strategies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission within physical spaces via air-based diffusion and circulation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission via touching interactions with surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simulation of specific scenarios within confined spaces to evaluate transmission risk","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
